sentences.sContent: He also seems to be slightly blinded by the sun, causing him to squint.
sentences.sContent_eng: He also seems to be slightly blinded by the sun, causing him to squint.
sentences.sCn: 他似乎也被强烈的太阳光照的有点睁不开眼睛，导致有点斜视的样子。

sentences.sContent: 'If you are one of the unfortunate people who frown or squint while they are concentrating at the screen then, over time, you will inevitably end up with frown lines,' Dr Prager, 42, said.
sentences.sContent_eng: 'If you are one of the unfortunate people who frown or squint while they are concentrating at the screen then, over time, you will inevitably end up with frown lines,' Dr Prager, 42, said.
sentences.sCn: 42岁的普拉杰医生说：“如果你在电脑前专心工作时常常蹙眉或眯眼斜视的话，那么很不幸，长此以往，你的面部将不可避免地出现皱纹。”

trans.tranOther: to have each eye looking in a slightly different direction
